intro: Sisymbrium shinnersii, commonly known as Shinners' mustards, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Sisymbrium shinnersii is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
